physical_appearance: This is a wooden carved memoriam plaque. It is rectangular in shape. The front features a rising sun design, with a cross in the middle. There is a carved inscription on a banner at the top, an 'RIP' on the cross, and the name and date at the bottom. The plaque is brown in colour.
sgcool_label_text: "A carved wooden ""In Memoriam"" plaque commemorating Lt. G.C. Kerr who was killed in action in Singapore on Feb 10th 1942. It would have possibly been assembled during internment and speaks to P.O.W efforts to remember their fallen comrades. This artefact is part of the archive of James Steele
title_text: "A carved wooden ""In Memoriam"" plaque commemorating ""Lt. G.C. Kerr. Killed in Action. Singapore. Feb 10th 1942"" and 1 postcard" Memoriam plaque commemorating Lt. G.C. Kerr.
subject_terms_1: world wars commemorative plaques prisoners of war
subject_terms_2: World War, 1939-1945 Plaques, plaquettes Prisoners of war
context_7: Great Britain. Army. Royal Field Artillery
